[[collapsible show="KUALIFICATIONS" hide="KLOSE"]]

* Playing For Both Sites - I have published one (1) article on the Wanderer's Library: [https://wanderers-library.wikidot.com/survival Survival]. There's no good reason for it to be over there instead of just a tale about SCP-4820 on this wiki, but the Wanderer's Depths contest prompt broke me out of a writing funk and for that I'm grateful.
* Social Butterfly - I don't do much critting these days, but I used to. One of my proudest contributions to the SCP wiki is greenlighting and critting [[[SCP-5392]]].
* Senior Researcher - I joined back in 2018. I'm old!
* Ten Steps Forward - My tenth (surviving) page was [[[The Drooling Path Part 4]]].
* Pollice Verso - My 1,000th vote was on [[[SCP-3636]]].
* Contender - The list of contests I've participated in has grown too long to practically list here, which I see as an accomplishment in itself.
* Guest Star Appearance - 6314 has a cameo from the Russian translation of SCP-4225.
* Team Building Exercise - Again in 6314, the Foundation actually has a peaceful interaction with the Circus of the Disquieting.
* Are We the Baddies? - We are in [[[SCP-7314]]] and [[[Red Pool Superfund Site]]]. 
* Dr. Worldwide - [[[SCP-5356]]] has been translated to five languages. So has [[[I a polar bear covering my nose in a snowstorm]]], technically.
* Periodic Publisher - Including the epilogue, the Drooling Path has six installments.
* Tall Tales - My tenth tale is [[[A Nightmare on 17th Street]]].
* Rise from the Ashes - [[[SCP-039]]] and [[[SCP-2068]]] are rewrites.

Incomplete:
* Canon Crossover Central (0/1) 
* The SEXTANK Initiative - SE_TANK
* Thank You For Your Cooperation (6/7) - I have collaborated with [[*user TAWNYOWLJONES]], [[*user GLASSAUTOMATON]], [[*user DRDAPPER]], [[*user SOUND CHASER]], [[*user ETHAGON]], and [[*user MASTERTMAN2]]. I refuse to count [[[One More Tomorrow]]] for this because it's really more like a collaborative log where we each kind of did our own thing, rather than a proper co-authoring situation.
* Double Double Agent (1/4) - UIU
* The Challenger (1/3) - Impostor Syndrome: [[[SCP-7587]]] is my best [[*user DR LEONERD]] impression, though [[*user WERYLLIUM]] understandably thought I was copying him instead. 
* Making Strides (45/50)
* Student Participation Award (0/2)
* Anartist Portfolio (3/5) - I made the crude schematics for 7314 myself. The "Oslo" entrance to [[[SCP-8297]]] is a picture I took at a creepy rest stop in central Tennessee. The picture in [[[SCP-8775]]] was taken by me of my own guitar.
* Knowledge is Power (0/1)
* Engaged (0/1)
* The Centurion (45/100)

[[size larger]]**__KOTH'S KONTINGENCY__**[[/size]]
[[/=]]
[[collapsible show="Krack Open Kollapsible" hide="Klose Kollapsible"]]
This living will activates if I'm ever permanently banned with no chance of appeal, if I go a full year without ANY activity whatsoever (no posting, no voting, no editing, no anything), or if I say so.  Under these circumstances:
* [[[SCP-4314]]] will become open to any rewrite attempt approved by the Rewrite Team, according to the appropriate policy for rewritable articles with absent authors.
* All the contents of my sandboxes, including the remains of any deleted articles I have stashed in there, are to be released under the same Creative Commons license as the wiki, if they aren't already, and deemed free for anyone to finish/expand upon.  If I am not here to write my ideas, I would rather someone else do it than for them to never be written at all.
* [[[SCP-5356]]] is to become a collaborative article, to which new additions meeting the previously established criteria (crosslinks reference an article, or a version of an article, that no longer exists) may be added. I ask that they be kept in approximate chronological order of deletion.
* Custodianship of the [[[Doctors of the Church Hub]]] shall fall to [[*user JERDEN]], if I have the power to bequeath it to him and if he wants it.

Additionally, if I ever go nuclear and self-delete all my articles, anyone who feels like it has my full permission to dredge them up from web archive or wherever and repost. Just make sure that you go through the proper staff channels or whatever (Rewrite Team probably?), so you don't get banned for plagiarizing me.
